result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Riley A Heikkinen

records.addlTxt:
Clerk: Amanda. 
Cases called at 2:15 pm.
INCLUDES: 21CT200, 21CT338, 22CF521, 22CM290. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo.  Defendant appears, and with Attorney Paige Metzman. 

Date & Time set for Pleas in CT matters and Review in the other two. 
VRCW. 

Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights filed.  

State moves to: 
21CT200 --
Ct.1(Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal))>>DRI.

21CT338 --
Ct.1(Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal))>>DRI.

COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA to:
21CT338 --
Ct.2(OWI (2nd))>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises defendant of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & questions defendant to understanding; 
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & voluntary made, a factual basis & defendant guilty;

COURT ORDERS:   Pay $1429 inclusive of all costs.  Serve 10 days MCJ with huber privileges for work/school/treatment or a combination;  No objection to EMP.  Any vehicle titled or registered in the Defendant's name is subject to IID installation for 12 months, as is the Defendant him/herself and device to be installed immediately;  IID installation fee to be paid.  12 months DL revocation with any administrative credit.  AODA (unless already completed).  Provide DNA sample.  Court finds 1 days credit.


Adj: 2:22 pm.

No contact with victim(s): S.C.E. (Non-Waivable). Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.   No Bars, Taverns, Liquor Stores or Beer Tents.   Absolute sobriety from and no possession of alcohol/controlled substances except prescriptions taken as prescribed.   Defendant shall not possess any dangerous weapons during the pendency of this action.   Report to ATTIC Corrections Services (715-848-3202) within one business day of release. Comply with pretrial monitoring through ATTIC Correctional Services at Level (1) supervision with possible drug testing as determined by agency screening.

- No bars, tavers, liquor stores, beer tents.
